lines.text: We came here to rob them and that's what we're gonna do - beat their heads in, gouge their eyes out, slash their throats. Soon as we wash the dishes.
Out of my way, you lout!

[deadpan]
You frighten me.

[looking at the Navy officer in full dress whites]
I think he looks like a glass of milk.
What if she knows his handwriting?
If you got a beautiful note like this, would you bother comparing signatures?
No. It'd have to be signed by a girl, though.
Tell him there's a deadly poisonous snake inside of the cage. Tell him.
[Joseph eaves the room. Re-enters a few seconds later]
You didn't tell him?

[after a pause]
He knows already.
I read someplace that when a lady faints, you should loosen her clothing.

[Sarcastically]
It's that kind of reading that got you into trouble.

[Speaking of their daughter]
Look! Every page of her diary... how much she loves him!

[Befuddled]
Hmmm? What? You - you - you read her private thoughts?
Why do you think I gave her the diary?
[Joseph brings Andre a spiny pineapple on a plate to eat with no utensils]
Knife! Fork! How am I supposed to eat that?

[matter-of-factly]
You eat it like an apple.
[Joseph gives him a look like this is common knowledge]
Don't misunderstand me. It's true that I never liked my cousin, only because he was not likable. He had a number of good points, I'm sure. I just can't think of any.

[forced out of Isabelle's room by Jules]
But you're supposed to when a girl faints!
Christmas has always been a wonderful time for me. In fact, that's how I got into trouble. I came home and found my wife giving my friend a... present.
What a shame.
Oh, it was my fault entirely. I should have written and told her I was coming.

[to Isabelle]
Your opinion of me has no cash value.
If crime showed on a man's face, there wouldn't be any mirrors.
I'll say one thing about prison. You meet a better class of people.
I'll say one thing for crooks - they give you an honest day's work.
That's the way it is, "in the midst of life," et cetera, et cetera, I forget the rest of it.
In the immortal words of somebody or other, "Well done, Adolphe."
If you don't mind my saying so, Albert, he's got it all over you.

[after failing to get any of the Ducotels to discover a body]
Isn't that always the way? When you have a body you don't want found everybody falls all over it!
Murderers are best, I think. They're so polite.
Even the girl herself called us angels.
We're no angels.
That is a very handsome woman.

[on opening the petty cash box]
You'll have to forgive me, it's been a while since I've done this
[closes eyes]
and I'm used to doing it in the dark.
I'm going to buy them their Christmas turkey.
"Buy"? Do you really mean "buy"?
Yes, buy! In the Spirit of Christmas. The hard part's going to be stealing the money to pay for it.

[Referring to the Ducotels]
People like that - how can you cut their throats?

[Dryly]
It isn't easy.

[to his wife]
You know how miserable I get when I'm unhappy.

[Talking about Joseph]
That's his life - selling people things they don't want for more than they can afford to buy.
I'd like to talk to you if can spare a few minutes.
A man sentenced to life can always spare a few minutes.
It's you?
How could I be anybody else?
Now I've really lost her.
You never really had her.
You look different.
We are different.

[seeing Isabelle for the first time]
I have a daughter about her age. She looked like her mother. Lovely woman, her mother. Wish I'd married her.

[handsome young doctor enters the store, and is spotted by the three convicts]
It's predestiny, that's what it is.
Nah, it's that fellow from the boat.
